heading: tape apology
subheading: dan burton told gop colleagues he's sorry about the release of the hubbell prison tapes, despite what he called the accuracy of most of the material. a "dear colleagues" letter by the chairman of the house government reform and oversight committee was far more contrite than the position of his top investigator, who was ordered fired by gingrich for his role in the affair. the aide, longtime clinton antagonist david bossie, took swipes at democrats and the white house, which he said stonewalled and "mischaracterized the editing" of the tapes.
author: wired staff
